issues.description: The constructor signature for StockIngredient in the template does not match the three-parameter constructor described in the problem statement. The problem specifies a constructor StockIngredient(String, int, int), but the template only provides StockIngredient(String, int, int, boolean), which will prevent students from instantiating StockIngredient as specified.
issues.suggested_fix: Add an overloaded three-parameter constructor to the template StockIngredient class, e.g.: public StockIngredient(String name, int price, int quantity) { this(name, price, quantity, false); }, so that StockIngredient(String, int, int) is available as specified.

issues.description: The constructor signature for StockIngredient is inconsistent across artifacts: the problem statement specifies a 3-parameter constructor StockIngredient(String, int, int), the template repository provides a 4-parameter constructor StockIngredient(String, int, int, boolean strictValidation), and the solution repository uses a 3-parameter constructor. This mismatch will confuse students about which constructor to call and prevent code from compiling as per the exercise requirements.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the template’s StockIngredient API with the problem and solution by removing the extra boolean parameter (strictValidation) or by adding a matching 3-parameter constructor (String, int, int), ensuring all artifacts reference the same StockIngredient constructor signature.
